articleContent.title: Chord: 11th in A# (Shape: G)
articleContent.content:
# Chord: 11th in A# (Shape: G)

## Description
The 11th chord in A# utilizing the G shape is an extended chord derived from the A# major chord. The chord consists of the notes A#, D, F, G, and C, adding the 11th note (G) to the basic triad. This creates a rich, lush sound that adds color and complexity to the harmony.

## Notes and Intervals
- A# (Root)
- D (4th)
- F (b6th)
- G (11th)
- C (5th)

The chord formula in relation to the root note is 1-4-b6-11-5.

## Genre and Flavor
The 11th chord in A# using the G shape is commonly found in jazz and R&B music. It has a sophisticated and jazzy flavor that can evoke a sense of tension and release. This chord is often used to create a dreamy, atmospheric quality in compositions.

## Songs
1. "Misty" by Erroll Garner
2. "Georgia on My Mind" by Ray Charles
3. "Don't Know Why" by Norah Jones
